metadata.synopsis: This goblin is wearing a pair of fancy breeches he stole off a dead dwarf. A dead dwarf that he's currently helping to cook, on a spit. The breeches have a poem inside that contains a clue the players might need to open a dungeon inside the goblin camp, but Klagga is unaware of this. He'd rather admire his own fashion sense and flirt than figure out what the poem means, and he can be convinced to sell it or give it away.

8.speaker: Tracker Klagga
8.text: Some coward move, poisonin' our drink. But we'll get them, you'll see.
8.context: NodeContext: Someone poisoned their beer and killed his mates. He's determined to catch the killer.

9.speaker: Tracker Klagga
9.text: Greetings, your most excellent drow-ness. What do you think of these breeches? Could be a new uniform.
9.context: CinematicNodeContext: adjusting his new breeches, swaggeringNodeContext: He's adjusting his new breeches, impressed with his own fashion-sense

58.speaker: Player
58.text: They look quite fetching on you.
58.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself, talking about his new breeches

116.speaker: Tracker Klagga
116.text: Proper stylish, ain't they? Nicked 'em off this dwarf we're cookin'.
116.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself, talking about his new breeches

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Tasty's not the word. Gruesome, maybe?
93.context: NodeContext: laughing off an insult about his fashion-sense; too confident to be upset

25.speaker: Tracker Klagga
25.text: Are you kiddin'? I look fantastic.
25.context: NodeContext: laughing off an insult about his fashion-sense; too confident to be upset

23.speaker: Tracker Klagga
23.text: An' I ain't takin' fashion advice from someone with worg-dung on their face.

22.speaker: Tracker Klagga
22.text: An' I ain't takin' fashion advice from someone who 'as to cut tail-holes in their pants.
22.context: NodeContext: mocking a tiefling player, but in a good-natured way

51.speaker: Tracker Klagga
51.text: Mebbe they're a bit loose, but that's cuz I keep myself in shape.
51.context: NodeContext: talking about his pants, confident, assured

96.speaker: Tracker Klagga
96.text: Not like that chunky dwarf I nicked 'em off.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: What happened to the rest of him?
71.context: NodeContext: amused, pointing at a dead dwarf he's cooking

78.speaker: Tracker Klagga
78.text: That's him, on the spit! Plenty of him to go around once he's cooked.
78.context: NodeContext: amused, pointing at a dead dwarf he's cooking

63.speaker: Player
63.text: You're talking about my kin. Show some respect.
63.context: NodeContext: surprised that the player is offended by cannibalism - amused. Grikka (rhymes with 'Sticker') is his friend, standing next to him. (rhymes with 'sticker')

13.speaker: Tracker Klagga
13.text: Don't take it personal. If my mate Grikka was dead and I woz hungry, I'd eat 'im.
13.context: NodeContext: surprised that the player is offended by cannibalism - amused. Grikka (rhymes with 'Sticker') is his friend, standing next to him. (rhymes with 'sticker')

35.speaker: Tracker Klagga
35.text: Bet he'd taste real good, too.
35.context: NodeContext: thinking aloud - imagining something tasty

49.speaker: Player
49.text: The dwarf - did he have anything on him? Besides pants.

1.speaker: Tracker Klagga
1.text: Dunno. Woz already stripped down to his breeches when I got my hands on 'im.

101.speaker: Tracker Klagga
101.text: Had a coupla coins in the pockets and some daft poem. But that's all.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Do you make a habit of eating dwarves?
79.context: NodeContext: explaining his taste for dwarf meat - a connoisseur

0.speaker: Tracker Klagga
0.text: 'S good meat if you can get it. Better than bloody chicken anyhow.
0.context: NodeContext: explaining his taste for dwarf meat - a connoisseur

89.speaker: Tracker Klagga
89.text: Shame he was as poor as a chicken.
89.context: NodeContext: complaining, talking about a dead dwarf who hardly had anything worth looting

40.speaker: Tracker Klagga
40.text: Nuffin' in his pants except a coupla coins and some lousy poem.
40.context: NodeContext: complaining, describing loot taken from a dead enemy

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I love poetry - can I see?
55.context: NodeContext: curious; senses a business opportunity

5.speaker: Tracker Klagga
5.text: Of course! I'm thinking of selling it - reckon it's worth anything, boss?
5.context: NodeContext: curious; senses a business opportunity

67.speaker: Tracker Klagga
67.text: Sure you can. But a look's all yer gettin'.
67.context: NodeContext: curious; senses a business opportunity

99.speaker: Tracker Klagga
99.text: For all I know, this little roaster was some famous bard and you'll be sellin' his last words for a pretty penny.
99.context: NodeContext: pleased with himself; trying to scam us out of money

82.speaker: Narrator
82.text: *The mark glows, but you feel nothing in response. Your illithid power is beyond reach until you rest.*

39.speaker: Narrator
39.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

114.speaker: Player
114.text: Ah, you're a secret poetry-lover. How cute.

2.speaker: Tracker Klagga
2.text: Wot? It's a load of old bollocks... all this moons and stars rubbish. Embarrassin' is wot it is.

105.speaker: Tracker Klagga
105.text: It's soft-stuff. Don't want nothin' to do with it.
105.context: NodeContext: said as he throws away a poem

117.speaker: Player
117.context: NodeContext: irritated, preparing to sell something and unsure of its value

81.speaker: Tracker Klagga
81.text: I dunno. But it must be worth sumfin'.
81.context: NodeContext: irritated, preparing to sell something and unsure of its value

80.speaker: Player
80.text: I think I know him. That's Piltrid the Warbler, the worst bard in Faerûn.
80.context: NodeContext: disappointed, but not too much

47.speaker: Player
47.text: You're wasting your time. Dwarven poetry is worthless.
47.context: NodeContext: disappointed, but not too much

62.speaker: Tracker Klagga
62.text: Really? Ah, shite. You might as well use it as bog roll then.
62.context: NodeContext: disappointed, but not too much

61.speaker: Tracker Klagga
61.text: Really? Ah, shite. You might as well use it as bog roll then.
61.context: NodeContext: disappointed, but not too much

108.speaker: Tracker Klagga
108.text: I'll get back to tendin' the meat.

10.speaker: Tracker Klagga
10.text: Hang on. I can't find the bloody thing. Somebody's robbed it!
10.context: CinematicNodeContext: patting down his pocketsNodeContext: surprised, patting down his pockets looking for a poem he was going to sell

27.text: I dunno. It rhymes an' everythin'. Reckon that's gotta be worth sumthin'.
27.context: NodeContext: skeptical, thinks he's being swindled

111.speaker: Tracker Klagga
111.text: I dunno. It rhymes an' everythin'. Reckon that's gotta be worth sumthin'.
111.context: NodeContext: skeptical, thinks he's being swindled

119.speaker: Player
119.text: He's one of my clan. Piltrid the Warbler, worst bard in Faerûn.
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: patting down his pocketsNodeContext: surprised, patting down his pockets looking for a poem he was going to sell

97.speaker: Tracker Klagga
97.text: Really? S'pose it don't matter that somebody already nicked it then.
97.context: CinematicNodeContext: patting down his pocketsNodeContext: surprised, patting down his pockets looking for a poem he was going to sell

6.speaker: Tracker Klagga
6.text: Really? S'pose it don't matter that somebody already nicked it then.
6.context: CinematicNodeContext: patting down his pocketsNodeContext: surprised, patting down his pockets looking for a poem he was going to sell

52.text: 'Ow can you recognise 'im with his face burned off? You tryin' to kid me?
52.context: NodeContext: referring to a dead dwarf - annoyed, thinks we're trying to fool him

103.speaker: Tracker Klagga
103.text: 'Ow can you recognise 'im with his face burned off? You tryin' to kid me?
103.context: NodeContext: referring to a dead dwarf - annoyed, thinks we're trying to fool him

110.speaker: Tracker Klagga
110.text: I reckon you know this thing is worth a proper pile of loot. So you better pay up.
110.context: NodeContext: Annoyed - this 'thing' is a poem we tried to fool him into giving away

73.speaker: Tracker Klagga
73.text: Cheers! Now I can get me a fancy belt and really impress the lads.

57.speaker: Tracker Klagga
57.text: Cheers! Now I can get me a fancy belt and really impress the lads.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: The Absolute does not ask. Certainly not twice.

66.speaker: Tracker Klagga
66.text: Of course! I wouldn't keep nuffin' from the Absolute!

59.speaker: Tracker Klagga
59.text: Of course! I wouldn't keep nuffin' from the Absolute!

88.speaker: Narrator
88.text: *A shiver runs across your mind... You feel sated.*

34.speaker: Narrator
34.text: *Something stirs deep within you, hungry and alert... it's taking something you'll never get back.*

118.speaker: Narrator
118.text: *Your mind lurches, reeling suddenly as if... bitten.*

92.speaker: Narrator
92.text: *A shadow swims across your vision, and a familiar voice tells you to be calm. You are loved.*

64.speaker: Narrator
64.text: *Your blood runs quicker, feeding the gnawing absence at the centre of your mind.*

112.speaker: Narrator
112.text: *The presence deep in your mind is awake, unblinking. This is it. A single word pervades your consciousness: 'Soon'.*

48.speaker: Narrator
48.text: *Your mind is full, bursting with ecstasy and terror. Finally, it is coming. You are becoming.*

7.speaker: Tracker Klagga
7.text: Er, don't be angry, boss, but I can't find the bloody thing. Someone must have nicked it.
7.context: CinematicNodeContext: patting down his pocketsNodeContext: apologetic, grovelling

95.text: Who you tryin' to kid? You want this for yerself. And that means you better cough up some coin.
95.context: NodeContext: amused, thinks he's got the better of us

43.speaker: Tracker Klagga
43.text: Who you tryin' to kid? You want this for yerself. And that means you better cough up some coin.
43.context: NodeContext: amused, thinks he's got the better of us

15.speaker: Tracker Klagga
15.text: Hang on. I can't find the bloody thing. Somebody's robbed it!
15.context: CinematicNodeContext: patting down on his pocketsNodeContext: patting down his pockets, surprised

53.speaker: Tracker Klagga
53.text: Give me enuff to buy a belt an' a fancy hat, an' it's yours.

90.speaker: Tracker Klagga
90.text: Cheers! Now I can get me a fancy belt and really impress the lads.

21.speaker: Tracker Klagga
21.text: Cheers! Now I can get me a fancy belt and really impress the lads.

20.speaker: Tracker Klagga
20.text: If you ain't willin' to pay up, I'll keep it!
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: patting down his pocketsNodeContext: surprised, apologetic

42.speaker: Player
42.context: NodeContext: his internal monologue - he's embarrassed about how much he likes this poem

75.speaker: Tracker Klagga
75.text: Some of these words are real pretty. But if the lads find out how much I enjoy it, they'll stick ME on the spit.
75.context: NodeContext: his internal monologue - he's embarrassed about how much he likes this poem

12.speaker: Tracker Klagga
12.text: Some of these words are real pretty. But if the lads find out how much I enjoy it, they'll stick ME on the spit.
12.context: NodeContext: his internal monologue - he's embarrassed about how much he likes this poem

65.text: What the hells are you doin'? Get out of my head!
65.context: NodeContext: strained - responding to a player trying to psionically control him, and he's angry and in discomfort

115.speaker: Tracker Klagga
115.text: What the hells are you doin'? Get out of my head!
115.context: NodeContext: strained - responding to a player trying to psionically control him, and he's angry and in discomfort

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I didn't make myself clear. Give it to me now.
54.context: NodeContext: apologetic, grovelling, bowing his head

113.speaker: Tracker Klagga
113.text: Right you are, boss. Hope you enjoy it.
113.context: NodeContext: apologetic, grovelling, bowing his head

91.speaker: Player
91.text: The Absolute does not ask. Certainly not twice.

46.speaker: Narrator
46.text: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*

41.speaker: Tracker Klagga
41.text: Someone else already snagged it. Weren't worth nothin' anyhow.

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I'll just take the coin then.
94.context: NodeContext: amused by our insolence - we just tried to swindle him

44.speaker: Tracker Klagga
44.text: You havin' a laugh? I need the money to buy meself a belt.
44.context: NodeContext: amused by our insolence - we just tried to swindle him

24.speaker: Player
24.text: How'd you manage to catch a dwarf?

29.speaker: Tracker Klagga
29.text: Daft bastard came to us! An' I'd been prayin' for a square meal...

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Is that the dwarf who tried to sneak into your camp?

3.speaker: Tracker Klagga
3.text: Silly little whisker-wart came bargin' in 'ere with his mates causin' a ruckus.
3.context: NodeContext: 'whisker-wart' is his slang for a dwarf - amused

83.speaker: Tracker Klagga
83.text: Now he's supper. That's wot happens to people that mess with us now we've got th'Absolute on our side.

84.speaker: Tracker Klagga
84.text: Really good pants though, ain't they? I thought so anyhow.

68.speaker: Tracker Klagga
68.text: Get any joy out of the poem? Load of nonsense, innit?

87.speaker: Tracker Klagga
87.text: Somethin' about the moon... an' stars?
87.context: NodeContext: confused, thinking aloud to himself, recollecting a poem

18.speaker: Tracker Klagga
18.text: Maybe I just ain't got the brains for it... but that dwarf poem don't make sense.
18.context: NodeContext: confused, slightly irritated with himself

109.speaker: Tracker Klagga
109.text: You look smart. Reckon it's worth anything?

102.speaker: Tracker Klagga
102.text: Get a good whiff of the meat - crackling up real nice, innit?
102.context: NodeContext: a chef, pleased with himself as he stands over the meat he's cooking

104.speaker: Tracker Klagga
104.text: Get any joy out of the poem? Load of nonsense, innit?
